column4: Does anyone have a manual partition walk through? Or wanna walk me through it?
I have free space that I deleted off, just for ubuntu
So I tried the freespace partition, after it does that, it stops on the swap with an error
I have 2 partitions, C,D for my vista and backup area, then I have the free space for linux
Brand new drive
you can try gparted
you have to manually make the rest of the area ext3/2
how would I do that?
right click on the unused space and what it says? or try up on the menu if u are trying to install linux....make it new partition from there
i had same problem i made that space ntfs then ext3
I did the new partition part, but it won't do anything past that.
but u have to make it ntfs then delete it probably..then u can
it doesnt ask u from cylinder to start from?
it does, and I have it started where it's supposed to be
thats where the problem lies
try changing the starting point..
after doing what you have said, I get an error, it says: The ext3 file system creation in partition #4 of SCSI3 (0,0,0) (sda) failed.
it didnt say anything else why or anything?
no that is the only information
try decreasing the size of the drive you are creating...
it's only 130 gigs
make it FAT and try formatting
Just formatted it again :(
